bu4qu4		不 去bù qùbú qùto not go

了 (le) marks completed actions, while 没有 (méiyǒu) is used for actions that didn't happen (so of course they're not completed).

column1: 下班以后你想跟我们一起去打球吗?
column3: Xiàbān yǐhòu, nǐ xiǎng gēn wǒmen yīqǐ qù dǎqiú ma?
column4: After we get off work, would you like to go play ball with us?

column1: 你到家后给我打电话。
column3: Nǐ dào jiā yǐhòu gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà.
column4: After you get home, call me.

column1: 结婚后爸爸不喝酒了。
column3: Jiéhūn yǐhòu bàba bù hējiǔ le.
column4: After he got married, dad stopped drinking.
Don't talk to me!

column1: 我昨天跟朋友去海滩了。
column3: Wǒ zuótiān gēn péngyou qù hǎitān le.
column4: I went to the beach with friends yesterday.

column1: 你什么时候跟你女朋友结婚？
column3: Nǐ shénme shíhou gēn nǐ nǚpéngyou jiéhūn?
column4: When are you gonna marry your girlfriend?

column1: 你想跟我一起去吗？
column3: Nǐ xiǎng gēn wǒ yīqǐ qù ma?
column4: Do you want to go with me?

column3: Qǐng nǐmen gēn lǎoshī yīqǐ dú.
column4: Please read together with the teacher.

column1: 结婚以后，你想跟父母一起住吗？
column3: Jiéhūn yǐhòu, nǐ xiǎng gēn fùmǔ yīqǐ zhù ma?
column4: Do you want live together with your parents after you get married?

column1: 今年中秋节你会跟家人一起过吗？
column3: Jīnnián Zhōngqiūjié nǐ huì gēn jiārén yīqǐ guò ma?
column4: Are you going to spend this Mid-Autumn Festival with your family?

column3:
我要跟你见面。

Wǒ yào gēn nǐ jiànmiàn.
column4: I want to meet with you.

column3:
我昨天跟他聊天了。

Wǒ zuótiān gēn tā liáotiān le.
column4: I chatted with him yesterday.

column3:
你什么时候跟她结婚？

Nǐ shénme shíhou gēn tā jiéhūn?
column4: When are you going to marry her?
Read after me. (跟 (gēn) also has a sense of "to follow" embedded in it. There's a before/after aspect.)

column1:
和我一起读。
跟我一起读。
column3:
Hé wǒ yīqǐ dú.
Gēn wǒ yīqǐ dú.
column4: Read with me. (simultaneous rather than before/after, so both correct)

column1: 今天太忙了，中午没办法出去吃饭。
column3: Jīntiān tài máng le, zhōngwǔ méi bànfǎ chūqù chīfàn.
column4: It's too busy today. There's no way to go out for lunch.

column1: 这里太吵了，我没办法工作。
column3: Zhèlǐ tài chǎo le, wǒ méi bànfǎ gōngzuò.
column4: It‘s too noisy here. I can't work.

column1: 他不开门，所以她没办法进去。
column3: Tā bù kāimén, suǒyǐ tā méi bànfǎ jìnqù.
column4: He didn't open the door, so she has no way to enter.

column1: 事情太多了，我今天没办法做完。
column3: Shìqing tài duō le, wǒ jīntiān méi bànfǎ zuò wán.
column4: There's too much to do. I have no way to finish today.

column1: 老板不同意，我没办法帮你。
column3: Lǎobǎn bù tóngyì , wǒ méi bànfǎ bāng nǐ.
column4: The boss didn't agree, so I have no way to help you.

column1: 他很笨，我没办法跟他一起工作。
column3: Tā hěn bèn, wǒ méi bànfǎ gēn tā yīqǐ gōngzuò.
column4: He's really dumb. There is no way I can work with him.
one or two days
three or four people

column1: 老板昨天喝了七八瓶胡萝卜汁。
column3: Lǎobǎn zuótiān hē le qī bā píng húluóbo zhī.
column4: The boss drank 7 or 8 bottles of carrot juice yesterday.

column1: 要做完这个工作需要一两个月。
column3: Yào zuò wán zhège gōngzuò xūyào yī liǎng gè yuè.
column4: To complete this work, you need one to two months.

column1: 这件衣服只要七八十块钱。

column4: This clothing only costs seventy to eighty kuai.

column4: These few books cost me two or three hundred kuai.

column3: Měi gè cài dōu hěn hǎochī.
column4: Every dish is delicious.

column1: 你每个人都认识吗？
column3: Nǐ měi gè rén dōu rènshi ma?
column4: Do you know every person?

column1: 这个班的每个学生都很聪明。
column3: Zhège bān de měi gè xuéshēng dōu hěn cōngming.
column4: Each of the students in this class are very smart.

column1: 老师每天都给我们很多作业。
column3: Lǎoshī měi tiān dōu gěi wǒmen hěn duō zuòyè.
column4: Every day the teacher gives us a lot of homework.
that person
this book
that matter (in the sense of business, affair, or thing)
this bottle of beer
that new computer
that cat
that river
which piece of clothing?
He is smarter than the teacher.

column3: Xiǎo Lǐ bǐ Xiǎo Zhāng gāo .
column4: Xiao Li is taller than Xiao Zhang.

column1: 星巴克的咖啡比这里的咖啡贵。
column3: Xīngbākè de kāfēi bǐ zhèlǐ de kāfēi guì.
column4: The coffee at Starbucks is more expensive than the coffee here.

column3:
他比我高。 (no 很)

Tā bǐ wǒ gāo.
column4: He's taller than me.

column3:
他比我高。 (no negatives)

Tā bǐ wǒ gāo.
column4: He's taller than me.

column3:
我跟他一样高。(no 一样, 比 used when not the same!)

Wǒ gēn tā yīyàng gāo.
column4: I'm as tall as him.

column1: 我哥哥比我更高。
column3: Wǒ gēge bǐ wǒ gèng gāo.
column4: My big brother is even taller than me.

column1: 这里的冬天比纽约的冬天更冷。
column3: Zhèlǐ de dōngtiān bǐ Niǔyuē de dōngtiān gèng lěng.
column4: The winter here is even colder than it is in New York.

column1: 你的问题比我的问题更麻烦。
column3: Nǐ de wèntí bǐ wǒ de wèntí gèng máfan.
column4: Your problem is even more troublesome than mine.
Don't leave.
Don't laugh!
Don't move!
Don't come over here!

column3: 别 like contraction of 不要, and little quicker and more forceful

column1: 他太累了，应该回家休息。
column3: Tā tài lèi le, yīnggāi huíjiā xiūxi.
column4: He's too tired. He should go home and rest.

column1: 明天你应该八点半来公司。
column3: Míngtiān nǐ yīnggāi bādiǎn bàn lái gōngsī.
column4: You should come to the office tomorrow at 8:30.

column1: 在中国，你应该喝白酒。
column3: Zài Zhōngguó, nǐ yīnggāi hē báijiǔ.
column4: In China, you should drink baijiu.

column1: 感冒的时候应该喝热水。
column3: Gǎnmào de shíhou yīnggāi hē rè shuǐ.
column4: You should drink hot water when you have a cold.
You should not tell him.
We shouldn't be late.

column1: 你们不应该拿别人的东西。
column3: Nǐmen bù yīnggāi ná biérén de dōngxi.
column4: You should not take other people's stuff.

column1: 这两个词的意思差不多。
column3: Zhè liǎng gè cí de yìsi chàbuduō.
column4: The meanings of these two words are pretty much the same.

column1: 这几个地方都差不多。
column3: Zhè jǐ gè dìfang dōu chàbuduō.
column4: These places are all pretty much the same.

column1: 我们的想法差不多。
column4: Our ways of thinking are pretty much the same.

column1: 那两家餐厅的菜差不多。
column3: Nà liǎng jiā cāntīng de cài chàbuduō.
column4: Those two restaurants' dishes are almost the same.

column1: 你们的中文水平差不多。
column4: Your Chinese levels are almost the same.

column1: 上海和纽约差不多。
column4: Shanghai and New York are basically the same.

column1: 这里的天气跟台湾的天气差不多。
column3: Zhèlǐ de tiānqì gēn Táiwān de tiānqì chàbuduō.
column4: The weather here is pretty much like Taiwan's.

column1: 我跟我哥哥差不多高。
column3: Wǒ gēn wǒ gēge chàbuduō gāo.
column4: My older brother and I are more or less the same height.

column1: 我差不多到公园门口了。
column3: Wǒ chàbuduō dào gōngyuán ménkǒu le.
column4: I'm almost at the entrance of the park.

column1: 电影差不多要开始了。
column4: The movie is almost about to start.

column1: 今天的工作差不多做完了。
column3: Jīntiān de gōngzuò chàbuduō zuò wán le.
column4: Today's work is almost done.

column1: 你儿子差不多五岁了吧？
column3: Nǐ érzi chàbuduō wǔ suì le ba?
column4: Your son should be about 5 years old, right?

column1: 他住在上海差不多三个月了。
column3: Tā zhù zài Shànghǎi chàbuduō sān gè yuè le.
column4: He has lived in Shanghai for about three months.

column1: 我父母结婚差不多二十年了。
column3: Wǒ fùmǔ jiéhūn chàbuduō èrshí nián le.
column4: My parents have been married for about twenty years.

column1: 差不多两个星期以前，我在北京见过他。
column3: Chàbuduō liǎng gè xīngqī yǐqián, wǒ zài Běijīng jiàn guo tā.
column4: About two weeks ago I met with him in Beijing.

column1: 你吃过饭了吗？
column3: Nǐ chī guo fàn le ma?
column4: Have you eaten (already)?

column4: She has already eaten (a meal).

column3: Wǒ yǐjīng shuā guo yá le.
